source: # Entity Name :  Inspector Address !

from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
from pyspark.sql.types import StructType, StructField, StringType, TimestampType
from pyspark.sql.functions import col, trim, regexp_replace

# Initialize Spark Session
spark = SparkSession.builder.appName("LakeDB_Transfer").getOrCreate()
%%sql
drop table odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address

spark.sql("""
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS odw_harmonised_db.inspector_addresses_monthly (

StaffNumber	string,
StreetandHouseNumber	string,
2ndAddressLine	string,
City	string,
District	string,
PostalCode	string,
RegionStateProvinceCount	string,
StartDate	string,
EndDate	string,
ChartingOfficer	string,
ChartingOfficerforInspector	string,
SubsPSgroup	string,
TelNo	string,
PersonalMobile	string,
WorkMobile	string,
Chngdon	string

 )
    USING DELTA
%%sql
drop table odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address

spark.sql("""
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address (
    StaffNumber STRING,
    StreetandHouseNumber STRING,
    2ndAddressLine STRING,
    City STRING,
    District STRING,
    PostalCode STRING,
    RegionStateProvinceCount STRING,
    StartDate STRING,
    EndDate STRING,
    ChartingOfficer STRING,
    ChartingOfficerforInspector STRING,
    SubsPSgroup STRING,
    TelNo STRING,
    PersonalMobile STRING,
    WorkMobile STRING,
    Chngdon DATE,
    ValHashKey STRING
)
USING DELTA
%%sql
describe  odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address
%%sql
select  * FROM odw_standardised_db.inspector_addresses_monthly
%%sql
set spark.sql.ansi.enabled
%%sql
set spark.sql.ansi.enabled = false ;

%%sql
select StartDate from odw_standardised_db.inspector_addresses_monthly
where not trim(StartDate) RLIKE '^\d{2}/\d{2}/\d{4}$'

%%sql
select StartDate from odw_standardised_db.inspector_addresses_monthly
where not trim(StartDate) RLIKE '^\d{2}/\d{2}/\d{4}$'

%%sql
SELECT StartDate
FROM odw_standardised_db.inspector_addresses_monthly
WHERE NOT REGEXP_REPLACE(StartDate, '[^0-9/]', '') RLIKE '^\d{2}/\d{2}/\d{4}$';

%%sql
SELECT StartDate
FROM odw_standardised_db.inspector_addresses_monthly
WHERE StartDate IS NULL OR TRIM(StartDate) = '';
# Waiting to work on date columns fix
%%sql
select * from odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address;

INSERT INTO odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address
(
    StaffNumber,
    StreetandHouseNumber,
    2ndAddressLine,
    City,
    District,
    PostalCode,
    RegionStateProvinceCount,
    StartDate,
    EndDate,
    ChartingOfficer,
    ChartingOfficerforInspector,
    SubsPSgroup,
    TelNo,
    PersonalMobile,
    WorkMobile,
    Chngdon,
    ValHashKey
)
SELECT 
    StaffNumber,
    StreetandHouseNumber,
    2ndAddressLine,
    City,
    District,
    PostalCode,
    RegionStateProvinceCount,
CASE 
        WHEN StartDate IS NULL OR TRIM(StartDate) = '' THEN NULL
        WHEN REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(StartDate), '[^0-9/]', '') RLIKE '^\d{2}/\d{2}/\d{4}$'
        THEN to_date(REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(StartDate), '[^0-9/]', ''), 'dd/MM/yyyy')
        ELSE NULL
    END AS StartDate,
    CASE 
        WHEN EndDate IS NULL OR TRIM(EndDate) = '' THEN NULL
        WHEN REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(EndDate), '[^0-9/]', '') RLIKE '^\d{2}/\d{2}/\d{4}$'
        THEN to_date(REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(EndDate), '[^0-9/]', ''), 'dd/MM/yyyy')
        ELSE NULL
    END AS EndDate,
    CASE 
        WHEN LEN(ChartingOfficer) = 6 THEN
            CASE 
                WHEN ChartingOfficer LIKE '50%' THEN CONCAT('00', ChartingOfficer)
                WHEN ChartingOfficer LIKE '42%' THEN CONCAT('50', ChartingOfficer)
                ELSE ChartingOfficer
            END
        WHEN LEN(ChartingOfficer) = 8 THEN ChartingOfficer
        ELSE ChartingOfficer
    END AS ChartingOfficer,
    ChartingOfficerforInspector,
    SubsPSgroup,
    TelNo,
    NULL AS PersonalMobile,
    WorkMobile,
    MAX(Chngdon) AS Chngdon,
    NULL AS ValHashKey  -- Add the missing column
FROM odw_standardised_db.inspector_addresses_monthly t1

GROUP BY
    StaffNumber,
    StreetandHouseNumber,
    2ndAddressLine,
    City,
    District,
    PostalCode,
    RegionStateProvinceCount,
    StartDate,
    EndDate,
    ChartingOfficer,
    ChartingOfficerforInspector,
    SubsPSgroup,
    TelNo,
    PersonalMobile,
    WorkMobile;

%%sql

-- Delete existing data from the table
DELETE FROM odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address;

-- Insert new data into the table
INSERT INTO odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address
(
    StaffNumber,
    StreetandHouseNumber,
    2ndAddressLine,
    City,
    District,
    PostalCode,
    RegionStateProvinceCount,
    StartDate,
    EndDate,
    ChartingOfficer,
    ChartingOfficerforInspector,
    SubsPSgroup,
    TelNo,
    PersonalMobile,
    WorkMobile,
    Chngdon,
    ValHashKey
)
SELECT 
    StaffNumber,
    StreetandHouseNumber,
    2ndAddressLine,
    City,
    District,
    PostalCode,
    RegionStateProvinceCount,
CASE 
        WHEN StartDate IS NULL OR TRIM(StartDate) = '' THEN NULL
        WHEN REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(StartDate), '[^0-9/]', '') RLIKE '^\d{2}/\d{2}/\d{4}$'
        THEN to_date(REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(StartDate), '[^0-9/]', ''), 'dd/MM/yyyy')
        ELSE NULL
    END AS StartDate,
    CASE 
        WHEN EndDate IS NULL OR TRIM(EndDate) = '' THEN NULL
        WHEN REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(EndDate), '[^0-9/]', '') RLIKE '^\d{2}/\d{2}/\d{4}$'
        THEN to_date(REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(EndDate), '[^0-9/]', ''), 'dd/MM/yyyy')
        ELSE NULL
    END AS EndDate,
    CASE 
        WHEN LEN(ChartingOfficer) = 6 THEN
            CASE 
                WHEN ChartingOfficer LIKE '50%' THEN CONCAT('00', ChartingOfficer)
                WHEN ChartingOfficer LIKE '42%' THEN CONCAT('50', ChartingOfficer)
                ELSE ChartingOfficer
            END
        WHEN LEN(ChartingOfficer) = 8 THEN ChartingOfficer
        ELSE ChartingOfficer
    END AS ChartingOfficer,
    ChartingOfficerforInspector,
    SubsPSgroup,
    TelNo,
    NULL AS PersonalMobile,
    WorkMobile,
    MAX(Chngdon) AS Chngdon,
    NULL AS ValHashKey  -- Add the missing column
FROM odw_standardised_db.inspector_addresses_monthly t1
WHERE t1.StartDate = (
    SELECT MAX(t2.StartDate)
    FROM odw_standardised_db.inspector_addresses_monthly t2
    WHERE t2.StaffNumber = t1.StaffNumber
)
GROUP BY
    StaffNumber,
    StreetandHouseNumber,
    2ndAddressLine,
    City,
    District,
    PostalCode,
    RegionStateProvinceCount,
    StartDate,
    EndDate,
    ChartingOfficer,
    ChartingOfficerforInspector,
    SubsPSgroup,
    TelNo,
    PersonalMobile,
    WorkMobile;

%%sql

-- Delete existing data from the table
DELETE FROM odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address;

-- Insert new data into the table
INSERT INTO odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address
(
    StaffNumber,
    StreetandHouseNumber,
    2ndAddressLine,
    City,
    District,
    PostalCode,
    RegionStateProvinceCount,
    StartDate,
    EndDate,
    ChartingOfficer,
    ChartingOfficerforInspector,
    SubsPSgroup,
    TelNo,
    PersonalMobile,
    WorkMobile,
    Chngdon,
    ValHashKey
)
WITH LatestRecords AS (
    SELECT 
        StaffNumber,
        StreetandHouseNumber,
        2ndAddressLine,
        City,
        District,
        PostalCode,
        RegionStateProvinceCount,
        StartDate,
        EndDate,
        ChartingOfficer,
        ChartingOfficerforInspector,
        SubsPSgroup,
        TelNo,
        WorkMobile,
        Chngdon,
        ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY StaffNumber ORDER BY StartDate DESC) AS rn
    FROM odw_standardised_db.inspector_addresses_monthly
)
SELECT 
    StaffNumber,
    StreetandHouseNumber,
    2ndAddressLine,
    City,
    District,
    PostalCode,
    RegionStateProvinceCount,
    CASE 
        WHEN StartDate IS NULL OR TRIM(StartDate) = '' THEN NULL
        WHEN REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(StartDate), '[^0-9/]', '') RLIKE '^\d{2}/\d{2}/\d{4}$'
        THEN to_date(REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(StartDate), '[^0-9/]', ''), 'dd/MM/yyyy')
        ELSE NULL
    END AS StartDate,
    CASE 
        WHEN EndDate IS NULL OR TRIM(EndDate) = '' THEN NULL
        WHEN REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(EndDate), '[^0-9/]', '') RLIKE '^\d{2}/\d{2}/\d{4}$'
        THEN to_date(REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(EndDate), '[^0-9/]', ''), 'dd/MM/yyyy')
        ELSE NULL
    END AS EndDate,
    CASE 
        WHEN LENGTH(ChartingOfficer) = 6 THEN
            CASE 
                WHEN ChartingOfficer LIKE '50%' THEN CONCAT('00', ChartingOfficer)
                WHEN ChartingOfficer LIKE '42%' THEN CONCAT('50', ChartingOfficer)
                ELSE ChartingOfficer
            END
        WHEN LENGTH(ChartingOfficer) = 8 THEN ChartingOfficer
        ELSE ChartingOfficer
    END AS ChartingOfficer,
    ChartingOfficerforInspector,
    SubsPSgroup,
    TelNo,
    NULL AS PersonalMobile,
    WorkMobile,
    Chngdon,
    NULL AS ValHashKey  -- Ensure this is acceptable for your use case
FROM LatestRecords
WHERE rn = 1;

%%sql

-- Delete existing data from the table
DELETE FROM odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address;

-- Insert new data into the table
INSERT INTO odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address
(

WITH LatestRecords AS (
    SELECT 
        StaffNumber,
        StreetandHouseNumber,
        2ndAddressLine,
        City,
        District,
        PostalCode,
        RegionStateProvinceCount,
        StartDate,
        EndDate,
        ChartingOfficer,
        ChartingOfficerforInspector,
        SubsPSgroup,
        TelNo,
        WorkMobile,
        Chngdon,
        ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY StaffNumber ORDER BY StartDate DESC) AS rn
    FROM odw_standardised_db.inspector_addresses_monthly
)
SELECT 
    StaffNumber,
    StreetandHouseNumber,
    2ndAddressLine,
    City,
    District,
    PostalCode,
    RegionStateProvinceCount,
    CASE 
        WHEN StartDate IS NULL OR TRIM(StartDate) = '' THEN NULL
        WHEN REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(StartDate), '[^0-9/]', '') RLIKE '^\d{2}/\d{2}/\d{4}$'
        THEN to_date(REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(StartDate), '[^0-9/]', ''), 'dd/MM/yyyy')
        ELSE NULL
    END AS StartDate,
    CASE 
        WHEN EndDate IS NULL OR TRIM(EndDate) = '' THEN NULL
        WHEN REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(EndDate), '[^0-9/]', '') RLIKE '^\d{2}/\d{2}/\d{4}$'
        THEN to_date(REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(EndDate), '[^0-9/]', ''), 'dd/MM/yyyy')
        ELSE NULL
    END AS EndDate,
    CASE 
        WHEN LENGTH(ChartingOfficer) = 6 THEN
            CASE 
                WHEN ChartingOfficer LIKE '50%' THEN CONCAT('00', ChartingOfficer)
                WHEN ChartingOfficer LIKE '42%' THEN CONCAT('50', ChartingOfficer)
                ELSE ChartingOfficer
            END
        WHEN LENGTH(ChartingOfficer) = 8 THEN ChartingOfficer
        ELSE ChartingOfficer
    END AS ChartingOfficer,
    ChartingOfficerforInspector,
    SubsPSgroup,
    TelNo,
    NULL AS PersonalMobile,
    WorkMobile,
    Chngdon,
    NULL AS ValHashKey  -- Ensure this is acceptable for your use case
FROM LatestRecords
WHERE rn = 1;

%%sql




WITH LatestRecords AS (
    SELECT 
        StaffNumber,
        StreetandHouseNumber,
        2ndAddressLine,
        City,
        District,
        PostalCode,
        RegionStateProvinceCount,
        StartDate,
        EndDate,
        ChartingOfficer,
        ChartingOfficerforInspector,
        SubsPSgroup,
        TelNo,
        WorkMobile,
        Chngdon,
        ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY StaffNumber ORDER BY StartDate DESC) AS rn
    FROM odw_standardised_db.inspector_addresses_monthly
)
SELECT 
    StaffNumber,
    StreetandHouseNumber,
    2ndAddressLine,
    City,
    District,
    PostalCode,
    RegionStateProvinceCount,
    REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(StartDate), '[^0-9/]', '') as StartDate,
    REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(EndDate), '[^0-9/]', '') AS EndDate,
    CASE 
        WHEN LENGTH(ChartingOfficer) = 6 THEN
            CASE 
                WHEN ChartingOfficer LIKE '50%' THEN CONCAT('00', ChartingOfficer)
                WHEN ChartingOfficer LIKE '42%' THEN CONCAT('50', ChartingOfficer)
                ELSE ChartingOfficer
            END
        WHEN LENGTH(ChartingOfficer) = 8 THEN ChartingOfficer
        ELSE ChartingOfficer
    END AS ChartingOfficer,
    ChartingOfficerforInspector,
    SubsPSgroup,
    TelNo,
    NULL AS PersonalMobile,
    WorkMobile,
    Chngdon,
    NULL AS ValHashKey  -- Ensure this is acceptable for your use case
FROM LatestRecords
WHERE rn = 1;

%%sql
SELECT 
    StartDate,
    TRIM(StartDate) AS TrimmedStartDate,
    REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(StartDate), '[^0-9/]', '') AS CleanedStartDate,
    to_date(REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(StartDate), '[^0-9/]', ''), 'dd/MM/yyyy') AS ParsedStartDate
FROM odw_standardised_db.inspector_addresses_monthly
WHERE to_date(REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(StartDate), '[^0-9/]', ''), 'dd/MM/yyyy') IS NULL
AND StartDate IS NOT NULL
AND TRIM(StartDate) != '';

%%sql
SELECT 
    StartDate,
    TRIM(StartDate) AS TrimmedStartDate,
    REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(StartDate), '[^0-9/]', '') AS CleanedStartDate,
    to_date(REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(StartDate), '[^0-9/]', ''), 'dd/MM/yyyy') AS ParsedStartDate
FROM odw_standardised_db.inspector_addresses_monthly
WHERE to_date(REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(StartDate), '[^0-9/]', ''), 'dd/MM/yyyy') IS NULL
AND StartDate IS NOT NULL
AND TRIM(StartDate) != '';

%%sql

Update odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address
	set ValHashKey=
		hashbytes('MD5',
			concat_ws('|',
			    StaffNumber,
				StreetandHouseNumber,
				2ndAddressLine,
				City,
				District,
				PostalCode,
				RegionStateProvinceCount,
				StartDate ,
				EndDate,
				ChartingOfficer,
				ChartingOfficerforInspector,
				SubsPSgroup,
				TelNo,
				PersonalMobile,
				WorkMobile,
				Chngdon
) )
				;
%%sql
select * from odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address;

%%sql
SELECT StartDate, LENGTH(StartDate), HEX(StartDate)
FROM odw_standardised_db.inspector_addresses_monthly
WHERE StartDate LIKE '%10/02/2024%';

%%sql

-- Delete existing data from the table
DELETE FROM odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address;

-- Insert new data into the table
INSERT INTO odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address
(
    StaffNumber,
    StreetandHouseNumber,
    2ndAddressLine,
    City,
    District,
    PostalCode,
    RegionStateProvinceCount,
    StartDate,
    EndDate,
    ChartingOfficer,
    ChartingOfficerforInspector,
    SubsPSgroup,
    TelNo,
    PersonalMobile,
    WorkMobile,
    Chngdon,
    ValHashKey
)
WITH LatestRecords AS (
    SELECT 
        StaffNumber,
        StreetandHouseNumber,
        2ndAddressLine,
        City,
        District,
        PostalCode,
        RegionStateProvinceCount,
        StartDate,
        EndDate,
        ChartingOfficer,
        ChartingOfficerforInspector,
        SubsPSgroup,
        TelNo,
        WorkMobile,
        Chngdon,
        ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY StaffNumber ORDER BY StartDate DESC) AS rn
    FROM odw_standardised_db.inspector_addresses_monthly
)
SELECT 
    StaffNumber,
    StreetandHouseNumber,
    2ndAddressLine,
    City,
    District,
    PostalCode,
    RegionStateProvinceCount,
    case when TRY_CAST(TRIM(StartDate) AS DATE) is null then TRY_CAST('01/01/9999' as date)
     else TRY_CAST(TRIM(StartDate) AS DATE) end as StartDate,
    ---to_date(REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(StartDate), '[^0-9/]', ''), 'dd/MM/yyyy')  AS StartDate,
    to_date(REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(EndDate), '[^0-9/]', ''), 'dd/MM/yyyy')  AS EndDate,
    CASE 
        WHEN LENGTH(ChartingOfficer) = 6 THEN
            CASE 
                WHEN ChartingOfficer LIKE '50%' THEN CONCAT('00', ChartingOfficer)
                WHEN ChartingOfficer LIKE '42%' THEN CONCAT('50', ChartingOfficer)
                ELSE ChartingOfficer
            END
        WHEN LENGTH(ChartingOfficer) = 8 THEN ChartingOfficer
        ELSE ChartingOfficer
    END AS ChartingOfficer,
    ChartingOfficerforInspector,
    SubsPSgroup,
    TelNo,
    NULL AS PersonalMobile,
    WorkMobile,
    Chngdon,
    NULL AS ValHashKey  -- Ensure this is acceptable for your use case
FROM LatestRecords
WHERE rn = 1;
%%sql
describe odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address

%%sql

INSERT INTO odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address
(
    StaffNumber,
    StreetandHouseNumber,
    2ndAddressLine,
    City,
    District,
    PostalCode,
    RegionStateProvinceCount,
    StartDate,
    EndDate,
    ChartingOfficer,
    ChartingOfficerforInspector,
    SubsPSgroup,
    TelNo,
    PersonalMobile,
    WorkMobile,
    Chngdon,
    ValHashKey
)

WITH LatestRecords AS (
    SELECT 
        StaffNumber,
        StreetandHouseNumber,
        2ndAddressLine,
        City,
        District,
        PostalCode,
        RegionStateProvinceCount,
        StartDate,
        EndDate,
        ChartingOfficer,
        ChartingOfficerforInspector,
        SubsPSgroup,
        TelNo,
        WorkMobile,
        Chngdon,
        ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY StaffNumber ORDER BY StartDate DESC) AS rn
    FROM odw_standardised_db.inspector_addresses_monthly
)
SELECT 
    StaffNumber,
    StreetandHouseNumber,
    2ndAddressLine,
    City,
    District,
    PostalCode,
    RegionStateProvinceCount,
    StartDate,
    EndDate,

    CASE 
        WHEN LENGTH(ChartingOfficer) = 6 THEN
            CASE 
                WHEN ChartingOfficer LIKE '50%' THEN CONCAT('00', ChartingOfficer)
                WHEN ChartingOfficer LIKE '42%' THEN CONCAT('50', ChartingOfficer)
                ELSE ChartingOfficer
            END
        WHEN LENGTH(ChartingOfficer) = 8 THEN ChartingOfficer
        ELSE ChartingOfficer
    END AS ChartingOfficer,
    ChartingOfficerforInspector,
    SubsPSgroup,
    TelNo,
    NULL AS PersonalMobile,
    WorkMobile,
    Chngdon,
    NULL AS ValHashKey  -- Ensure this is acceptable for your use case
FROM LatestRecords
WHERE rn = 1;

%%sql

SELECT 
    StartDate,
    TRIM(StartDate) AS TrimmedStartDate,
    REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(StartDate), '[^0-9/]', '') AS CleanedStartDate,
    cast(to_date(REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(StartDate), '[^0-9/]', ''), 'dd/MM/yyyy') as date) AS ParsedStartDate
FROM odw_standardised_db.inspector_addresses_monthly
LIMIT 10;

%%sql

select *   FROM odw_standardised_db.inspector_addresses_monthly

%%sql

-- Delete existing data from the table
DELETE FROM odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address;

-- Insert new data into the table
INSERT INTO odw_harmonised_db.inspector_address
(
    StaffNumber,
    StreetandHouseNumber,
    2ndAddressLine,
    City,
    District,
    PostalCode,
    RegionStateProvinceCount,
    StartDate,
    EndDate,
    ChartingOfficer,
    ChartingOfficerforInspector,
    SubsPSgroup,
    TelNo,
    PersonalMobile,
    WorkMobile,
    Chngdon,
    ValHashKey
)
WITH LatestRecords AS (
    SELECT 
        StaffNumber,
        StreetandHouseNumber,
        2ndAddressLine,
        City,
        District,
        PostalCode,
        RegionStateProvinceCount,
        StartDate,
        EndDate,
        ChartingOfficer,
        ChartingOfficerforInspector,
        SubsPSgroup,
        TelNo,
        WorkMobile,
        Chngdon,
        ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY StaffNumber ORDER BY StartDate DESC) AS rn
    FROM odw_standardised_db.inspector_addresses_monthly
)
SELECT 
    StaffNumber,
    StreetandHouseNumber,
    2ndAddressLine,
    City,
    District,
    PostalCode,
    RegionStateProvinceCount,
    -- Parse StartDate in 'dd/MM/yyyy' format
    CASE 
        WHEN REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(StartDate), '[^0-9/]', '') RLIKE '^\\d{2}/\\d{2}/\\d{4}$'
        THEN to_date(REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(StartDate), '[^0-9/]', ''), 'dd/MM/yyyy')
        ELSE NULL
    END AS StartDate,
    -- Parse EndDate in 'dd/MM/yyyy' format and handle '31/12/9999'
    CASE 
        WHEN EndDate = '31/12/9999' THEN NULL  -- or '9999-12-31'
        WHEN REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(EndDate), '[^0-9/]', '') RLIKE '^\\d{2}/\\d{2}/\\d{4}$'
        THEN to_date(REGEXP_REPLACE(TRIM(EndDate), '[^0-9/]', ''), 'dd/MM/yyyy')
        ELSE NULL
    END AS EndDate,
    -- Handle ChartingOfficer logic
    CASE 
        WHEN LENGTH(ChartingOfficer) = 6 THEN
            CASE 
                WHEN ChartingOfficer LIKE '50%' THEN CONCAT('00', ChartingOfficer)
                WHEN ChartingOfficer LIKE '42%' THEN CONCAT('50', ChartingOfficer)
                ELSE ChartingOfficer
            END
        WHEN LENGTH(ChartingOfficer) = 8 THEN ChartingOfficer
        ELSE ChartingOfficer
    END AS ChartingOfficer,
    ChartingOfficerforInspector,
    SubsPSgroup,
    TelNo,
    NULL AS PersonalMobile,
    WorkMobile,
    Chngdon,
    NULL AS ValHashKey  -- Ensure this is acceptable for your use case
FROM LatestRecords
WHERE rn = 1;
